title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty. This message is unclear and confusing. It is not clear whether this is an error or a warning. Additionally, the message should be displayed in red with the error icon if it is indeed an error. It should be noted that the user is unable to create a default package since it is always present.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard and leaving the package name field empty, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard and leaving the package name field empty, no warning or error message should be displayed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java project. 
2. Select the project. 
3. Open the New Java Package wizard.
